These decks control not only the moves available to players, but also their life total, with damage being applied directly to the deck itself.

Player fight against one or more giant monsters printed on 10x10 miniboards placed in the center of the play area. Unlike most "big bad" games, the Monster Cards in Wrathborne Champions have set attacks and actions performed each round. This "AI code" lets players predict a great deal of how the monsters will act, allowing them to make tactical choices during their turns to increase the likelihood of success.

Monster Card life is tracked via Life Cards in a similar fashion to player decks. Most of these life cards are benign, but some alter the state of play dynamically, sometimes twisting the control out of the player's hands. Players defeat a Monster Card when all Life Cards are removed from the sectors of the Monster Card that can attack. The game ends when the last Monster Card is defeated, or the final player is killed.
175327.name: Wrathborne Champions
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 038 – Jamaica vs Thunder Alley vs Race! Formula 90

175328.description:
Cast & Capture is a unique and innovative take on classic fishing card games (ex. Casino).

In Cast & Capture, you are a mage specializing in the collection of wondrous creatures for the Arcane Academy. You must use your knowledge of the elements and arcane powers to capture a variety of mystical and magical creatures before your fellow mages. It is only by using your wits to blend the right spells and group the right creatures that you can earn the title of Master Capturer.

There are 2 decks in the game: a Creature deck and a Spell Deck. Each creature and Spell have a Power and Element tied to them. To begin, mages are given 4 Spells at random from the Spell deck and 4 creatures are placed on the field. Each turn a new creature will come onto the field and the mage whose turn it is will use their Spells to attempt to capture any number of creatures on the field that match the Power and Element of the Spell they cast. If they cannot capture a creature, then their spell is added to the Spell Pool to be used by any mage. Mages refresh their hand of Spells when they run out.

Using the Spell Blending and Creature Grouping mechanics, mages will use light strategy and symbol recognition to blend spells to create new ones and even group creatures together to make bizarre and whimsical combinations. By mastering Blending/Grouping, it helps the mage to ensure that the right spell is always at hand and maximum number of creatures are captured per spell.

With beautiful, hand-drawn illustrations and a unique split-card, dual-deck design; Cast and Capture updates an old gaming favorite for a new generation of players both young and old.
175328.name: Cast & Capture

175329.name: Mindstorm: Neldark
175329.description:
From the publisher website:
Neldark è un’ambientazione evocativa e drammatica, ricca di scenari imaginifici e storie memorabili

English translation:
Neldark is an evocative and dramatic setting, full of memorable stories and imaginative scenarios

175330.name: Iron Gods Pawn Collection
175330.description:
From the back of the pack

Key monsters and NPCs from the Iron Gods Adventure Path come alive on your tabletop with the Iron Gods Pawn Collection, featuring more than 100 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn presents a beautiful full-color image of a monster or NPC from the Iron Gods campaign, including androids, aliens, scrappers, and dozens of unique pawns also suitable for representing player characters. The Iron Gods Pawn Collection, together with the creatures from the Pathfinder Pawns: Bestiary Box collections, provides pawns for nearly every Iron Gods encounter. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base from any of the Bestiary Box collections, making the pawns easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With tons of distinct images, the Iron Gods Pawn Collection brings to life the enemies and allies from all six adventures of the Iron Gods Adventure Path.

Fires of Creation
Lords of Rust
The Choking Tower
Valley of the Brain Collectors
Palace of Fallen Stars
The Divinity Drive

175332.name: CARRIER STRIKE FORCE: A Solitaire Game of Carrier Operations in the Pacific (1942-1945).
175332.description:
INTRODUCTION
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a Game where you are a Commander of a Carrier Air Group (CAG) in the Pacific during World War II (1942-1945). Your Goal is to manage your aircraft to successfully search for and destroy Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Forces in order to bring victory to the allied forces.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is to score a pre-determined number of Victory Points (VP) by destroying Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Units. The US has up to 24 Turns to Control at least 150 VP worth of Bases OR have destroyed at least 60 VP worth of Japanese Ships and Aircraft. If the Player does not accomplish this, the Player loses and Victory is uncertain for the Allies.

GAME FEATURES
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a BIG Game with many counters and a 6-Sheet Map with large Hexes. Aircraft include F4F Wildcats, F6F Hellcats, F4U Corsairs, SBD Dauntless Dive Bombers, TBF Avenger Torpedo Bombers, A6M Zero Fighters, D3A Val Dive Bombers, B5N Kate Torpedo Bombers and G4M Betty Medium Bombers. Ships include Destroyers, Light and Heavy Cruisers, Battle Ships and Carriers. Ground units include Artillery batteries, Anti-Aircraft Batteries, and Convoys.

CARRIER STRIKE FORCE can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net/

175333.name: Smorgasboard
175333.description:
Smorgasboard is a board game for foodies, friends and family alike. Players take on the guide of aspiring chefs as they work their way around the board in search of gastronomic success.

The object of the game is to be the first team of chefs to graduate from Rick's Culinary Academy by answering questions from the following categories:

4BIDDEN-FRUIT
KITCHEN-KAOS
NUUDLE-DOODLE
TASTO-QUEST

Basically a food and drink based variant of Trivial Pursuit for 2-4 players/teams.

boardgameintegration: Widower's Wood: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
Widower's Wood: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
175334.description:
The Undercity puts a spin on the classic dungeon crawl adventure, setting it within the vast underground labyrinth of one of the Iron Kingdoms’ most famous cities.

This board game for two to four players and comes with a seven-adventure campaign. The players play one to four characters from the Iron Kingdoms universe as they try to weed out a nefarious evil that has been lurking in the Undercity of Corvis.

All players will be playing on the same team and the game requires no game master. The players work together defeating enemies, achieving objectives, and gaining experience that can be used to give new skills to their characters that can be used in subsequent adventures in the campaign.

The game will come with almost 40 different miniatures with 16 different sculpts. The four heroes are Milo Boggs (the alchemist), Canice Gormleigh (the gun mage), Gardek Stonebrow (a trollkin warrior), and Pog (a gobber mechanic) that controls a light warjack named Doorstop.

Each character has a starting stat sheet, but players can purchase character ability cards with XP gained from the adventure to enhance and customize their characters.

Combat is based on rolling dice against opposing attributes. Players will be able to use feats and abilities to give boosts to these dice rolls, similar in many ways to other games based in the Iron Kingdoms.
175334.name: The Undercity: An Iron Kingdoms Adventure Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 6 - Our GenCon 2015 Preview and Twilight Struggle Review

175335.name: The Dragon's Hoard
175335.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fire and Gold!

The first trilogy of White Box Adventures reaches its fiery climax with The Dragon's Hoard, an adventure for between six and eight characters of 7th to 9th level for Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox!. After defeating the wererats of Willowford and discovering the terrible secret of the Nameless Wizard in his hidden tower, a band of brave heroes must brave the volcanic flaming pass and challenge an ancient red dragon and his fire giant army! The fate of Willow Valley is in their hands! Featuring new monsters, devious traps and a climactic finale to the story which began in The Wererat's Well and continued in The Wizard's Tower, this adventure can be played as a close to the trilogy or stand completely on its own. Can you brave the Keep of the Flaming Pass and claim the dragon's hoard?

175336.name: An Average Modern Jazz Club
175336.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacob opened the heavy front door and entered The Ivory Note. The club was dark and the smell of cigarettes still hung in the air from the previous night. He strained to hear movement, but the entire club seemed devoid of life. Quickly and quietly, Jacob walked to the railing overlooking the main club.

Reaching into his left pocket, he produced a pair of mirrored sunglasses and slipped them over his eyes. Instantly, the room was awash in green hues. He could easily make out the rows of tables covered in white table cloths and toped with a single white rose. On stage, he saw the white grand piano that was the club's trademark. Hanging above it, he could clearly see the body of a woman in a long dress.

A voice boomed. "Ms. Mason sends her regrets. She is tied up at the moment. She hopes that you were join her later." The statement was punctuated by hideous laughter. Immediately, figures began to appear at the front and rear of the building.

Where do you go when the action starts? To the battle map, of course! If you need a map of a modern structure, you need Modern Floorplans. The Modern Floorplans series from Fabled Environments offers gamers high quality maps in a variety of configurations:

Want to draw it out yourself? Use the 8.5x11 map as a guide.
Want to simply drop the map on the table and play? Use either the full-scale map (if you have access to a plotter printer) or print the tiled version on regular paper and assemble a full-size version yourself in a matter of minutes. Both versions are scaled at 1 inch equals 5 feet.
In addition, each floorplan also comes in versions without room labels and without furniture.
This flooplan take advantage of both the Layers feature and the Tile Large Page function of Adobe Acrobat X




Note: All floorplans are rendered in black and white.
All maps are created by an architectural drafter using AutoCAD. This gives all of the maps the realistic feel that your players crave. Grab a copy of Modern Floorplans: An Average Modern Jazz Club today, and keep an eye out for future releases!

Map Description

Although the original concept for this map was a small jazz club, this venue is extremely flexible. At the southern end of the building is the main entrance, bar area and a set of bathrooms. The main seating area, consisting of two and four person tables, is slightly recessed. At the northern end of the building is a small stage, dressing room and office. Direct access to these areas are availble through a service door to the right side of the stage.

Don't need a jazz club, no problem. Turn off the furniture layer and you have a wide open space perfect for a dance club or small band venue with standing room only seating.

175337.name: Killer Chops
175337.description:
From publisher blurb:

Henry DuBois is in a pretty tough spot. His club isn't doing so well and a string of violent murders in the neighborhood hasn't done wonders for business. To give himself a leg up, DuBois just poached one of the best trumpet players in the city from the club on 45th, but the guy went from kind to kind of a jerk seemingly overnight. Karmari has stormed off stage at the drop of a hat and has gone off on other employees. Without Karmari Harmon, the club is finished. However, he seems to be imploding for no apparent reason.

Your job is simple: figure out what is going on with Karmari before the club tanks!

“Killer Chops” is a modern horror adventure for 4–6 players using Fabled Environments’ “Jazz Club” and “Warehouse” maps and the Savage Worlds core rules, suitable for an evening’s play. An 8 1/2 inch x 11 inch copy of each map is provided.

175338.name: An Average Modern Pool Hall
175338.description:
From publisher blurb:

It wasn't hard to spot Brannon Kelly. The leader of the Southies was a tall, thin man with red hair and a bent nose that spoke volumes about his short time on this earth. Around him was his crew decked out in jackets, ball caps and tattoos sporting the Irish Flag and a smattering of Gaelic.

Seeing Jacob across the room, he nodded and offered a smile. The smile on his face quickly faded as he spotted the rage in Jacob's eyes.

"You," Jacob screamed as he pointed at Brannon. "You're the reason my partner's dead. Now its your turn to join him!"

Where do you go when the action starts? To the battle map, of course! If you need a map of a modern structure, you need Modern Floorplans. The Modern Floorplans series from Fabled Environments offers gamers high quality maps in a variety of configurations:

Want to draw it out yourself? Use the 8.5x11 map as a guide.
Want to simply drop the map on the table and play? Use either the full-scale map (if you have access to a plotter printer) or print the tiled version on regular paper and assemble a full-size version yourself in a matter of minutes. Both versions are scaled at 1 inch equals 5 feet.
In addition, each floorplan also comes in versions without room labels and without furniture.
This flooplan take advantage of both the Layers feature and the Tile Large Page function of Adobe Acrobat X




Note: All floorplans are rendered in black and white.

All maps are created by an architectural drafter using AutoCAD. This gives all of the maps the realistic feel that your players crave. Grab a copy of Modern Floorplans: An Average Modern Pool Hall today, and keep an eye out for future releases!

Map Description

This is a classic pool hall with a small bar, 10 public tables and a semi-private table in the back. This is the perfect place to meet a local gang boss, hook up with a contact or simply kick back and relax.

175339.name: An Average Modern Game Store
175339.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacob tossed the two six-sided dice onto the table. "Six," someone at the table offered. He picked up the small game piece shaped like a shovel and moved it six spaced on the tan colored board.

Jacob couldn't remember the last time he had an evening to himself. When he saw the internet post about a board game night at a local game store close to his house, he figured he'd give it a shot. Now he sat around a table playing a game with five complete strangers and was having a blast.

As he picked up the dice to take his next turn, Jacob saw the glass doors to the store fly open and three men in ski masks walk in. They were armed with pump-action shotguns and menacingly swept them around the room.

"Nobody move," the tallest of three commanded. Spotting the games on the tables, the masked man added, "this is not a game."

Jacob rolled his eyes. "Are you serious?"

Where do you go when the action starts? To the battle map, of course! If you need a map of a modern structure, you need Modern Floorplans. The Modern Floorplans series from Fabled Environments offers gamers high quality maps in a variety of configurations:

Want to draw it out yourself? Use the 8.5x11 map as a guide.
Want to simply drop the map on the table and play? Use either the full-scale map (if you have access to a plotter printer) or print the tiled version on regular paper and assemble a full-size version yourself in a matter of minutes. Both versions are scaled at 1 inch equals 5 feet.
In addition, each floorplan also comes in versions without room labels and without furniture.
This flooplan take advantage of both the Layers feature and the Tile Large Page function of Adobe Acrobat X




Note: All floorplans are rendered in black and white.

All maps are created by an architectural drafter using AutoCAD. This gives all of the maps the realistic feel that your players crave. Grab a copy of Modern Floorplans: An Average Modern Pool Hall today, and keep an eye out for future releases!

Map Description

This is a 5000+ square foot game store with all the bells and whistles. The store has three semi-private gaming areas, tons of shelf space for product and a private office in the back. In addition, a wall forms a large area that is perfect for tournaments or organized play events.

175340.name: An Average Modern Ranger Station
175340.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacob hated summer camp when he was a kid. This trip did nothing to change his opinon. This was supposed to be a weekend alone at a great camping spot near an old summer camp. However, he now found himself in a game a tag with a pack of werewolves.

Jacob ran with only the light of the full moon to help him navigate through the dense forest. He could hear them loping behind just toying with him and waiting for the moment that he could no longer run.

In the distance, he spotted the old ranger station and it gave him hope. He ran for the old structure with a renewed vigor. His heart sank as he saw the mangled corpse of the ranger on the porch. The glowing eyes in the treeline told him that he had no where else to go.

Where do you go when the action starts? To the battle map, of course! If you need a map of a modern structure, you need Modern Floorplans. The Modern Floorplans series from Fabled Environments offers gamers high quality maps in a variety of configurations:

Want to draw it out yourself? Use the 8.5x11 map as a guide.
Want to simply drop the map on the table and play? Use either the full-scale map (if you have access to a plotter printer) or print the tiled version on regular paper and assemble a full-size version yourself in a matter of minutes. Both versions are scaled at 1 inch equals 5 feet.
In addition, each floorplan also comes in versions without room labels and without furniture.
This flooplan take advantage of both the Layers feature and the Tile Large Page function of Adobe Acrobat X




Note: All floorplans are rendered in black and white.

All maps are created by an architectural drafter using AutoCAD. This gives all of the maps the realistic feel that your players crave. Grab a copy of Modern Floorplans: An Average Modern Pool Hall today, and keep an eye out for future releases!

Map Description

This free download is of a two-story ranger station with a submerged garage area. It boasts only one bedroom, but plenty of room to relax and welcome visitors from the neighboring summer camp.

175341.name: An Average Modern Shopping Mall
175341.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacob was out of breath as he staggered through the automatic door to the mall. His lungs were on fire and his muscles ached, but he knew that he couldn't quit now. He started the day with six full clips of ammunition, now only one round remained in his ASPs pistol. He had decided to save that one in case he guessed wrong and there was no ammunition available anywhere in the Ambry Square Mall.

Jacob glanced back at the automatic doors and expected to see a mass of undead flooding through the opening, but there was no movement and nothing but eerie silence. Ahead he spotted one of the mall's directory displays. He chaotically scanned the directory . "Beautiful Brains and Games...no," he said absently to no one in particular. " "Up In Arms" - Floyd Toastmaster's Survival Gear & Armory..promising, Silver Gryphon Games...no, Rohan's Chainsaw and Dynamite Emporium..okay, but not exactly what I'm looking for, Juv-N8 Health Spa...nope, Sizzled Wyvern Tavern...later maybe, Sapper Joe 's Wargaming & Toys...no, Fighting Pirannha Graphics, no."

Suddenly, Jacob smiled and thrust his fist into the air. "Schott's Guns...now we're cookin' with gas!" Just as suddenly, Jacob heard the doors to the mall slide open and saw several shambling figures enter.

Where do you go when the action starts? To the battle map, of course! If you need a map of a modern structure, you need Modern Floorplans. The Modern Floorplans series from Fabled Environments offers gamers high quality maps in a variety of configurations:

Want to draw it out yourself? Use the 8.5x11 map as a guide.
Want to simply drop the map on the table and play? Use either the full-scale map (if you have access to a plotter printer) or print the tiled version on regular paper and assemble a full-size version yourself in a matter of minutes. Both versions are scaled at 1 inch equals 5 feet.
In addition, each floorplan also comes in versions without room labels and without furniture.
This flooplan take advantage of both the Layers feature and the Tile Large Page function of Adobe Acrobat X




Note: All floorplans are rendered in black and white.

All maps are created by an architectural drafter using AutoCAD. This gives all of the maps the realistic feel that your players crave. Grab a copy of Modern Floorplans: An Average Modern Pool Hall today, and keep an eye out for future releases!

Map Description

This map is a 2-story 100 store mall that is over 1.5 million square feet. Provided are 9 repeating store floor plans and one detailed anchor store. In addition, the surrounding parking lot, food court and children's play area have been detailed. Also two sheets of fixture icons have also been provided, which will allow users to either use repeating floor plans or detail a space themself.

Given the size of this structure, the map has been broken up in to several large-format vignettes that players can print out and throw on the table.

175343.name: Sherlock Holmes: salapoliisipeli
175343.description:
Sherlock Holmes is a variant on the famous whodunnit detective game (called Cluedo in the UK, Clue in the US) especially for younger children to play.

In this variant players move between 9 different places. One item has been stolen from mr. Newlyrich's summer cottage. The goal is to find out the stolen item, the thief and the place where the item is hidden.

This game also exist in a Swedish edition, made by Alga.

175345.name: NIP'AJIN Shots
175345.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of 7 German, short oneshot scenarios, all necessary rules and an introduction to RPGs.

Includes a scenario about a flooded dwarfen fantasy mine, an alien rampaging on a space station, street racing in modern-day San Diego, kids defending a house from robbers, a desert apocalypse in modern USA, a brawl in an irish pub and celebrities fighting for attention on a prom.

Created for the Gratisrollenspieltag (the German Free RPG Day).

175346.name: Casus Belli (Issue 30 - Jan 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Bâtisses et Artifices: La ferme fortifiée
Devine Qui Vient Dîner Ce soir...
Les Gens qui font le jeu: Denis Gerfaud
The Third World War: "Battle for Germany"
Tribune: A bas Donjon, vive Dragon
175346.description:
(Translated) from the cover:


Bâtisses et artifices: a new player's aid
Wargames index: all our articles since issue 1
3 adventure modules:
Rêve de Dragon
AD&D
Maléfices

Third World war: Battle for Germany

175347.name: Casus Belli (Issue 31 - Feb 1986)
rpgissuearticle: Bâtisses et artifices: Les secrets de la teinturerie
Devine qui vient dîner ce soir...
Dis moi monsieur Cabaes, dessine moi un monstre
La compagnie du bout du monde
Les gens qui font le jeu: Jean-Pierre Pécau
Retrospective tout la Fantasy: Les Grands Classiques
175347.description:
(translated) from the cover:


Concours: une aventure dont vous êtes l'auteur!
Two adventure modules: Jeu de Rôle
Two solo adventures


Modules: AD&D level 8, Call of Cthulhu. Solo adventures: Das Schwarze Augo and a "Thriller" ready to play. Micro: Ultima IV. Wargames: Air Force, Fall of France. And the news, player's aides, monsters... and a vine scrapper by Cabanes...

175348.name: Seeds
175348.description:
The Baroness DeMalus has hired two of the barony’s most skilled gardeners to beautify her walking grounds. Unfortunately, and as the baroness well knows, these two gardeners are vicious enemies and will do anything to ruin the displays of the other. But there is beauty to be found in their creations, if only they can line them up properly before the other can stop it from happening!

Seeds is a print-and-play microgame of competitive gardening and flower arranging for two players that uses only sixteen cards. It takes about ten minutes to play a game and is provided for free.

Players attempt to plant three of their own plants in a row, but are restricted on where they can plant by the plant that their opponent has played.

175349.name: Casus Belli (Issue 27 - Aug 1985)
rpgissuearticle: Le bon, la brute et les brigands
Némésus ou le portrait du Diable
175349.description:
User summary:

Special Scenarios.

AD&D 1
Légendes Celtiques
Call of Cthulhu
Traveller
Empire Galactique
Aftermath




For boardgames:

Baston
Car Wars
Cry Havoc/Siège
Squad Leader

175350.name: Mythos Hero's Handbook
175350.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Olympians have spoken and you are to join the ranks of heroes and heroines involved in the Heavenly Contest! The Olympian deities are in a race to find the successor to Zeus’s throne, with the successor acquiring the greatest number of followers. But the gods and goddesses are quite busy, and to shine their light upon the mortals of Hellas requires intervention of a divine scale. Heroic deeds are a must if one is to prove themselves worthy for the gratification of Olympus and the pursuit of seeing their patron deity rise to rulership! Are you strong, brave, and smart enough for the challenge? We will see how you fair against the great beasts of Hellas and the heroes and heroines who support your rival deity. This is the Heavenly Contest. This is Mythos!

In Mythos, you assume the role of a demigod or devoted human of the gods and goddesses of Olympus in a heroic mythological representation of Ancient Greece. Heroes and heroines join in the Heavenly Contest to prove their worth to the deities and spread the word of their patron deity to the mortals of Hellas, in hopes of raising their patron deity to the Olympus throne. Heroes and heroines come from all walks of life, representing their patron deity as adventurers, fighters, hoplites, Olympic athletes, courtesans, sages, and rogues. Through affiliations with deific cults and Mystery Cults, they gain access to great powers and follow the strands of Fate as they travel Hellas in search of their next, grand performance.

Inside the Hero's Handbook you will find:

An introduction to mythological Ancient Greece and the Heavenly Contest
The demigod Background
Divine Qualities
Mystery Cults Talents
A collection of patron deities from Greek Mythology
Everything a player needs to create characters in Mythos.
… and more!

175351.name: Treasury of the Kingdom (Pathfinder)
175351.description:
From publisher blurb:

Treasury of the Kingdom brings you a bevy of magical items perfect for the freeholder lords of a newborn kingdom hacked out of the wilderness. Here can be found tools of war like the shield of the encroaching forest and battle standard of the fallen, but also implements of exploration to blaze trails through forest and field, hill and vale like the survivalist's arrow and scout's spyglass. You will also find items that interact with the kingdom-building rules described in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Campaign and expanded in Ultimate Rulership from Legendary Games, like instant signal towers, crown of affirmation, and the plow of the abundant harvest. Finally, since explorers in the deep wild are not moving into lands uninhabited, but rather places that are haunted by the magical and mysterious fey and monstrous tribes alike, from the burning skull mace and hag's eye to the staff of the fey queen! In all, you'll find over 40 magic items, from single-use ephemera to a pair of mighty artifacts; everything you'll need to stock your wilderness kingdom campaign with an array of awesome items to intrigue your players and enrich their enemies. If it's fantastical items that delight and excite, your PCs will love what they find in the Treasury of the Kingdom.

175352.name: Atlas Hârnica Map H5
175352.description:
User summary:

Map covering Misyn, Araka-Kalai, and north-eastern Lake Benath and its shores.

175353.name: Araka-Kalai (2nd edition)
175353.description:
From the first page:

Araka-Kalai is, according to legend and the doctrine of the Ilviran church, the dwelling of the god Ilvir. Located in the isolated Misyn region, the site’s dominant feature is a huge limestone sinkhole known as the Pit of Araka-Kalai. An ancient tower stands on a rocky island in the Pit, surrounded by a liquefied, fermenting sludge with a stench that puts to shame all other offensive smells. Beneath this crumbling tower, in dank, endless caverns, the Accursed Lord of the Barren Cycle is said to spawn his "fatherless multitude," the bizarre creatures known as the Ivashu.


User summary:

Revised and expanded edition of the original 1987 article from the Araka-Kalai[/rpgitem] book.

175354.name: Chimerae: Centaur
175354.description:
User summary:

Expansion including pp. 3-4 of Chimerae article, focusing on Hârnic centaurs.

175355.name: Film Festival in a Box: The Interactive Movie Game
175355.description:
Film Festival in a Box is the new interactive movie game that brings award-winning independent films into your living room! The game is easy to play, an intriguing conversation starter, and a fun way to entertain family and friends.

Players watch DVDs of indie movies and then vote on the best pictures or rank the films. Winner is the one with most individual matches to overall group votes.

175356.name: Minilaous Keep
175356.description:
Publisher blurb:

Minilaous is a keep and barony southwest of the Kandian city of Aleath. The keep is nestled atop the high cliffs of Mercia Bay. The region has a rich heritage, arising from a mix of cultures. The area was decimated during the Thecracy of Tekhos but emerged as an independent kingdom before becoming part of the Kindom of Kanday. The barony is held by Baroness Iala Pesirias, the only female tenant-in-chief in the kingdom.

The Minilaous Keep article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, and economics, and provides details for some of its craftsmen and other locations. A full description and color floor plans are given for the keep. Also includes color local maps for GMs and players.

Portions of this article were originally published in 2001 as part of the Web of the Widow CD-ROM adventure module.

175357.name: Moleryn Castle
175357.description:
Publisher blurb:

Moleryn is the capital of the Thardic Republic's Ramala Province and the seat of the provincial magistrate and marshal. It is also the headquarters of the Ramala Legion and houses two of its eight companies. Moleryn sits on the Salt Route, the main corridor for trade between western and eastern Hârn, and prospers as an important trading center.

The Moleryn Castle article describes the settlement's history, government, religion, and economics, and provides details for some of its craftsmen and other locations. A description and color floor plans are given for the castle, as well as for the Magistrate's Palace, home to the corrupt government officials. Also includes color local maps for GMs and players.

Portions of this article were originally published in 1987 as part of the Thardic Republic module.

175358.name: Arathel Inn: Haakapik Inn
175358.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Haakapik Inn is on the bleak, rocky shores of Arathel, a small island off the northwest coast of Orbaal. Visitors include merchants and ships' crews seeking rest after a long voyage. The inn is an important hiring hall for sealing captains seeking additional help or replacing injured hands during the spring and summer months. The Haakapik Inn serves mostly Ivinians, as proprietor Jarri Kurn makes it clear that Jarin are not welcome at his inn.

The Haakapik Inn article provides details about the inn's accommodations and services, as well as its menu, staff, and regular clientele. Detailed floor plans are provided as well as several adventure hooks. This article is a companion to Drunken Hake.

This article is an expansion of Arathel, part of Castles of Orbaal (COL #5022).

175359.description: A kickstarter exklusive golden base robot. Was sent too all backers months before the game was published.
175359.name: PBL ROBOTS: Gold Base Robot

175360.description:
W1815 is a simple strategy game that simulates the key events of the battle of Waterloo in 15 minutes. The French side can try a number of different strategies in an attempt to crush the Anglo-Allied army before the Prussians arrive. Meanwhile, the Anglo-Allied player must focus on keeping his army in the battle by using reserves in right situations until the Prussians get into the action.

The game contains a battlefield map which is used to record casualties and the current strength of the participating armies. The cards are setup around the battlefield map with each card representing a corps. Players take it in turns to activate one corps and carry out an action. The rules for each individual corps action are described on the cards. The results of these actions are then recorded on the battlefield map. The game ends when either army fails a rout test or the time marker is moved to the night square.
175360.name: W1815
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 2, Episode 4
I've Been Diced! episode 71: Mutants, game studies, and 2015 in review
Low Player Count - Ep 14 - Free Form
Low Player Count - Ep. 15 - The Filler Episode
Podcast #104 - Juegos o juguetes

175362.name: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent
boardgameexpansion: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 1 – Somalia Intervention
Modern Africa: Scenario Book 2 – Marine! Intervention Operations in the Third World
Modern Africa: Scenario Book 3 – Tears: SEAL Operations in Nigeria
175362.description:
Modern Africa is a set of rules to fight/refight battles on the dark continent in the 1960´s through the 1990´s. The majority of these battles were smaller scale fought between warlords or other dictators. The arms were either leftovers from an earlier era, state-sponsor (US or USSR) supplied, or black market purchased. These are not the latest, greatest weaponry and they may not even be welded by trained soldiers, but the goal was always freedom.
The game is played with 15mm miniatures.

175363.description: In the two-player game Glaisher, players separate and move their stacks in order to connect the opposite sides of the board. The mechanis,s for separation and movement of stacks are dictated by integer partitions with distinct parts, i.e., splitting numbers into sets of different smaller numbers. Players might recognize this mechanism from Kakuro puzzles. The game is therefore named after mathematician James Glaisher, who devised a theorem about integer partitions.
175363.name: Glaisher

175364.description: A Kickstarter exclusive add-on reward, of five alternative Class I ghosts.
175364.name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game – Zombie Taxi Drivers

175366.name: El Juego del Come Come
175366.description: Every player has to get as many of their markers to the opposite edge, preferably in the right order, thus achieving the highest points. They must also avoid losing their markers, if one of your markers goes off the sidelines on your left or right, or if your market is "eaten" by other player.

175367.description: Published in Command magazine #19, this variant adds 6 new units to the German OB (heavy Assault Guns and Selft Propelled Heavy antitank Guns, for the Historical scenario, "Maximun" Historical Scenario and Operation "Eclipse"
175367.name: German Heavies: A Berlin'45 Variant

175368.name: Salamander Verkehrs-Zeichen-Spiel
175368.description: The players begin at the parking lot near space 1. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 48 at the Salamander shoe store wins the game. At severaL spaces special rules are printed on the game board.

175369.description:
This variant adds ten Soviet and one Estonian counters for the Non Historical Scenarios.
Also contains errata for the Historical Scenario German reinforcements.
175369.name: Soviet Maximum Effort and the Estonians

175370.name: Boerderij Spel
175370.description:
A farm isn't a farm without it's animals. Throw the dice, move your pawn and purchase the animals and machines by paying the requested amount. Primary goal of this game is to purchase the animals related to your farm. First one to succeed is the winner of the game.

An educative game of trade and luck

175371.name: Wer kann lesen?
175371.description:
Four games to learn reading.

Game 1 (alphabet game): Match upper and lower case letters.

Game 2 (caterpillar game): Find the matching words for given starting letters.

Game 3 (pictures and words): Find the matching words for given pictures.

Game 4 (pictures and letters): Create the words for given pictures.

175372.name: Ernies und Berts Farben-Memo
175372.description: Memory-type game with lots of characters from Sesame Street to learn matching colors and shapes.

175373.name: Yippi
175373.description:
A wild-west adventure with Benjamin Blümchen and his friends, Otto, Chief Black Feather and his daughter, Red Feather.

Twelve Cattle were stolen and must now be returned home. But the way home is hard to find: you turn right, then left and sometimes there is no way! You have to look closely and build the way anew, relocating the game boards if nescessary.

To play, the 16 large game boards are laid out in a 4x4 grid on the floor.

Each cattle is assembled by putting the die-cut cattle in a colored standee. Then, the cattle are randomly distributed between the players. All players start at the same spot on the grid, Mike Donalds Ranch.

On your turn, a player throws the die and moves his pawn along the way, one field for each pip. The goal is to reach the color-coded pasture, matching the color of one of his cattle. To do this, it is allowed to change the grid of game boards to open up new paths and maybe hinder the other players on their plans. The first player to place all his cattle in the right pastures wins the game!

175375.name: Perfekt auswärts: Urlaubs-Französisch
175375.description:
Learn first language ability with this game!

The game is played in four rounds. In the first round, you only use the cards 1 to 10 and the blue cardboard counters. Shuffle the cardboard counters face down. Give each player a card with a short phrase in french on it, the lowest number starts then. Pick up a cardboard counter and read the word aloud (it is written both in latin letters and in phonetics). Each player listens carefully, and says "yes" if he thinks this word belongs to his card. He then put the counter on his tray. If the sentence from his card is now complete, he reads it to the other players and gives a translation. The translation can be checked with the translation wheel. If it is correct, he keeps the card, otherwise the first player giving a correct translation gets the card. A round is played until all cardboard counters are gone. Then you start another round with new cards and new counters. Afer four rounds, the player with the most cards is the winner.

175376.name: Der Smaragd des Maharadschas: Ein mörderisches Rollenspiel für 6-8 Diebe und anderes Gesindel
175376.description:
The game plays in the palace of a maharajah. It's a mixture of board game and role play.

A crime has happened: a smaragd was stolen. The players try to find out, what happened and which Person(s) have committed the crime.

Each player gets a character (Maharajah, Maharani, Guru, ...), and instructions on how to play their character.

There are 2 parts:

Moving a pawn around the plan of the palace by rolling a die to find objects.
Interrogate the other players to get more information.




Both should lead the players as team or against each other to solve the crime.

175377.description:
Promo tile for The Ancient World, made available through the Dice Tower 2015 Season 11 Kickstarter.

Rules: When you send a citizen here, roll a die. If you roll a Titan, you get a scroll. If you roll a coin, you get a coin. If you roll nothing, you get nothing.
175377.name: The Ancient World: Citadel of Ivories Promo

175378.name: Vorsicht Stufe!
175378.description:
Be the first to lay all your stair parts on the gameboard to win! A simple color and recognition game for younger kids.

Each player gets stair parts in different lenghts (10 with 2 players, 7 with 3 and 6 with 4). Spinn the color wheel and put one of your stair parts on the matching stair on the game board with exactly two persons step on it. It is possible that you can't place a any of your stair parts (no matching size, not able to match exactly two persons, not enough free space on the chosen stair). If so, you must collect all stair parts from the chosen stair. The player who has placed sucessfully all of his stair parts is the winner!

175379.name: Suchen und finden
175379.description: Charlie and Lola are always in the middle of the action! Lola likes to play with her friend Lotta, drinks strawberry milk or goes on a walk with Sizzles. Charlie likes to play soccer with his friend Marv or looks after his little sister. But what exactly is happening? Two spinners show which tile the players must find, as fast as possible! Whoever got six tiles, wins!

175380.name: The Affair of the Orb
175380.description:
Publisher blurb:

Follow the trail of an assassin in the swashbuckling fantasy world of Margaret Weis and Robert Krammes' DRAGON BRIGADE! Based on the novella "The Affair at the Orb" by Chris Pierson, this self-contained adventure game book includes Cortex Plus rules, characters, and a thrilling action mystery story for up to six players and one Game Master. Just add polyhedral dice and your own witty repartee.

175381.name: Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles: Pizza-Memo
175381.description:
Teenage Mutant Hero Turtles need their pizzas badly!

Shuffle the 16 pizza pieces facedown and lay them in a 4x4 pattern facedown on the table.

Each player gets a Turtle board with its 9 matching counters. On his turn, a player turns pizza pieces face up as long as they all are matching. He stops after the first different piece and turns all pieces facedown. Then it's the next players turn. If a player happens to find all four pieces, he fills his Turtle board with four of his nine counters. The second completed pizza only nets three counters, the third two counters and the fourth and last pizza only one counter. When all four pizzas are found, the pieces are shuffled and placed anew. The first player to place all his nine counters on his turtle board wins!

175382.name: Dora Tip & Flip
175382.description:
Dora Tip & Flip a educative Memory game with a special flip mechanic based on the series character Dora.

There are some variants in playing:

Normal searching of pairs
Searching a Special pair given by a Card
Searching a Special pair given by the English Name on the Card.

175383.name: Rot! Achtung! Ampel!
175383.description:
A traffic game with dice and event cards.

Each player rolls the six-sided die and moves his pawn around the game board. At a roll of "1" you draw an event card and follow the instructions. At a roll of "6" you may roll and move again. The goal is to collect a picture card in each shop visited. Be the first to have 6 cards and win the game.

175384.name: Benjamin Blümchen: Lern das ABC!
175384.description:
Four different game variants to learn the alphabet with Benjamin Blümchen!

The games included are:

Color-Dominoes, where player have to match color-coded buffers of the waggons. If done right, the ape is in the first, the bear in the second, the chameleon in the third waggon and so on until the zebra in the last waggon. The player to match all of his waggon tiles first, wins.

Color-Memo, where the train build in the first game is used again. Here, the waggons are turned on the other sid, where only a color and a uppercase letter is visible. All players use now the pawn showing Benjamin Blümchen and a six-sided die to walk along the train. Where Benjamin stopps, the player must name the animal in the waggon. If correct, the player gets the matching card. When all cards are found, the player with the most cards wins.

A B C game. The waggons must be added in the correct sequence, the color-coded buffers are used for self-control. Can be played by one player or cooperatively.

Where is my waggon? Each animal wants to find his own waggon. All the waggons are shuffled and laid out in the middle of the table, showing only the backside. The cards are also used again here. A card is drawn and the animal on it announced. The player to the right of the card drawer is the first to try to find the matching waggon. If he is correct, he gets the card, otherwise the next player tries it. When all cards are found, the player with the most cards wins.

175385.name: Chef, ärgere dich nicht!: Das Spiel um Wissen und Karriere
175385.description:
This game is a party game. The story behind it is making career in your company. The career level is shown by the position of your figure in the company building.

You go your way up by rolling the dice and fulfilling your tasks. These tasks can be knowledge questions (getting harder the higher you come on your career) and actions. Both tasks are given by cards to be taken on action fields.

Actions could be e.g. making gymnastic lessons or kiss the other players.

175386.name: 101 Dalmatians: The game based on the film
175386.description:
Cruella, the cruel fashion designer holds many little Dalamatian puppies hostage in Hell Hall to make their pretty coats into elegants furs. She did not, however, reckon with Pongo, Perdy, Fogey and Sergeant Tips. These four are on their way to release the puppies. Teh player who can release the most puppies from Hell Hall and bring them home has won the game.

Three routes are going to Hell Hall, where you can find the puppies. Choose the short one, and test your luck. Cruella may hide here often and takes the puppies away. On the long one, your odds are better and you may find a soot chip to mask your puppies. The last route goes over the river and you face the chance to hit the water, losing your puppies to Cruella again!

175387.name: Noah und die Tiere
175387.description:
A memory game with a twist.

Shuffle the 40 tiles and place them facedown on the table. Get each player a board. On your turn, turn two tiles face up. If you find a pair of an animal or Mama Noah and Papa Noah, place them on your board. Else, turn the tiles face down and pass the turn. The first player to completely fill his board with Mama and Papa Noah and four pairs of animals wins the game.

175388.name: Farben lernen
175388.description:
Learn the colors and match them with pictures. Three learning games in one box.

Variant 1:
Three cards make a set. These sets are marked with a little animal (a bug). If you place cards of one set side by side, the bugs match each other, when placed correct.
Shuffle all 36 cards and place them faceup on the table. On your turn, throw the die. On 2, 4 or 6 take any one card from the table and place it front of yourself. On 1, 3 or 5 pass the turn to the next player. Try to collect all three cards of a set. No one may take a card belonging to a set started by another player. You may start a new set only after you finished a set. The game ends when all cards are collected. The player with the most cards in front of him wins.

Variant 2:
Memory - play with the 24 picture cards or with all 36 cards. If played with 36 cards, always turn up three cards and try to find the matching triplets.

Variant 3:
I spy with my litte eye something ... Use the color cards to determine the color to spy and use the chips as victory points.

175389.name: Give the Dog a Bone
175389.description:
Short print run dexterity and dice game from Waddingtons. Players pull back and release Barney the dog to propel him around a track looking to uncover a number of bones buried at points along the track by the players as determined by a die roll.

Play continues until all 40 bones have been uncovered, the player with the most wins.

175390.name: Gunship Platoon: A Solitaire Game of Helicopter Gunship Combat in Vietnam (1965-1973).
175390.description:
GUNSHIP PLATOON is a Game where you are a Commander of Platoon of Helicopter Gunships (the Gun Platoon) in a Helicopter Assault Company in Vietnam. Your Goal is to manage your aircraft and Complete a Campaign consisting of a series of Missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist the war efforts. Campaigns can be Short (8 Missions), Moderate (12 Missions), or Long (16 Missions). Combat is based on an innovated Initiative system that allows a single player to manage many units and gives the feeling of lining up a strafing run.

GAME FEATURES: GUNSHIP PLATOON features many colorful game counters of a large variety of Units including UH-1D and UH-B Hueys, OH-6 Cayuse and AH-1 Cobras, US Aero-Rifle Squads, VC and NVA infantry, M-113s, M-48s, T-54s, PT-76s and others.

GUNSHIP PLATOON can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net/

175391.name: Kampf um Wildpferde
175391.description:
Each player has 4 cowboys in 4 colors (each player the same).
A player start with 1 field diagonal movement each turn.
After the player has reached special marked fields with all 4 cowboys, he now moves like the chess horse trying to get on the field were the wild horses are placed at the begin of the game.
Reaching one of them he brings it with the same kind of moves back to his ranch.

There is one White Mustang on the field this can be caught by one Player in the same way after bringing 3 wild horses back to the ranch.

Game ends after a preset number of rounds.

Wild horses in the ranch 10 Points, on the way to the ranch 5 Points, White Mustang in the ranch 20 Points.
Special rule: The Player has to choose a different Color as the openent had chosen on his last turn.

175392.name: Das Quiz-Spiel mit der Maus
175392.description:
Based on the high-flying German TV franchise "Die Sendung mit der Maus", this family game requires you to puzzle, guess, combine and evaluate.

The gameboard shows lots of different tasks to solve, placed in a round course. Your goal is to race once around the course and be the first to reach your starting point again. Each field gives you another task to solve, it is always you against all others. If you suceed, you step on field forward, else all other players step on field forward! The tasks test your knowledge, your evaluation skills, your memory and your dice-throwing skills.

175393.name: Our Town Trivia: Camp Rockwood
175393.description: Players move around the board and must answer trivia questions from one of four color categories matching the space they are on, for the level (1 thru 5) they are currently on in order to continue their turn. If space is indicated as a bridge, advance to the next level. Correctly answer a Level 5 question and win the game.

175394.name: Spaßvogel Spiel: Städteflug-Spiel
175394.description:
Spaßvogel Spiel is a role-and-move game.
The track has 3 parts.

Each Player has to collect a full set of city Cards to get in the next part of the track (1st and 2nd part).
There are fields with the city names. Each time a player hits one of these fields he gets one of the cards of this city.
Due to the fact that the number of cards of 1 City is limited the player gets the card from another player if he knows who has this card.

The third part is only a short part to come to the finish field.
There are some special event fields (fixed events and card driven). Cards are for example: Joker city-Card, Exchange city-Cards, has to skip 1 or 2 turns.

175395.name: Zingeln
175395.description:
A exciting encircle game for 2 players.

The aim of the game is to encircle the opponent in 21 turns so that he is unable to move. The five blue pawns are set up at the simple rimmed fields of the plan, the green pawn on the opposite double-edged field. This field markings apply only to the starting positions. The player with the green pawn starts and counts his turns. He may move forward, backward, go sideways and diagonally, while his opposite player, the driver, with his five pawns may move forward, backward and sideways, but can not move diagonally. Turns are take alternately, moving always only one pawn. Skipping over another pawn is not allowed. The driver must now try to encircle his opponent so that he can not move anymore. If he can do that in at last 21 turns, he's the winner. Otherwise, the other player has won.

Trivia:
"Zingeln" is a non-existent short form of "umzingeln", meaning encircling in german.

175396.name: Poleaxed 2
175396.description:
From the intro:

"The Poleaxed wargames system is designed to represent, as far as possible, the type of warfare that was waged in Western Europe during the 15th century.

The prime aim of the system has always been to wargame large battles, to get a clear cut result (pun intended) and to bring out the flavor of the period. To do this, the rule mechanisms have been made as simple as possible. Morale checks and book-keeping are kept to a minimum. The need to remove figures has been eliminated and all movement can be carried out by contingents on movement trays."

175397.name: Mein erstes Rechnen
175397.description:
Learing by playing, that's fun!

variant 1,2: Memory. Match the number card with the picture card showing excatly this number of items. In the second variant, use the plus card also.

variant 3: Place the 12 number cards faceup on the table. Shuffle plus and minus cards into one stack. On your turn, draw a card from the stack and read one of the tasks on it to the next player, clockwise. If he can solve the task by pointing to the correct number card on the table, he gets the task card, otherwise the next player has a chance to solve it. Whoever gets to solve six tasks first is the winner!

175398.name: Die Montagsmaler
175398.description:
This game is based on a German TV game show.

The game is played in 2 teams.
On teams turn one member is chosen.

He looks on a card what he has to draw. His team members try to name the Thing as fast as possible. If this is right the drawer takes the next card and starts drawing this.
This continues till the time has gone (hourglass finished).
Each card gives 1 Point and the other team, makes the same with new cards.

The game ends after each Player was the drawer.

175399.name: Incoboto
videogamehonor: 2013 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
175399.description:
When The Corporation causes all the suns to go out, a small boy named Inco and his strange friend, Helios, go on a galaxy-spanning quest to light the skies once more.As they explore the planets they discover Grapples, Jetpacks, Teleports, Gravity Beams and other strange machines.Incoboto is a challenging, atmospheric adventure-puzzler in the spirit of Portal and Ico.

Source: The Developer Website.

175400.name: Freeport: The City of Adventure (3rd edition)
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Nominee
175400.description:
From the back cover:

Freeport is one of the classic city settings of fantasy roleplaying and it’s back—bigger and better—in this monstrous new sourcebook for The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Freeport: The City of Adventure lovingly details a metropolis that mixes classic fantasy, piracy, and Lovecraftian horror into an action packed setting for your game. As always, you can use Freeport on its own or drop it into your campaign setting of your choice.

Inside this massive tome you'll find:


A district by district breakdown of the city with accompanying neighborhood maps.
Over 100 fully detailed locations, from taverns and beer halls to prisons and asylums.
Useful information on the city's customs, politics, laws, and history.
Hundreds of characters that make Freeport come alive, many with full stat blocks.
The Ironjack Legacy, a brand new adventure for low-level characters by Fiery Dragon.
Three new character classes: freebooter, monster slayer, and noble.
New archetypes like corsair, musketeer, and witch hunter.
New feats, spells, equipment, and magic items.
An optional chapter that expands the World of Freeport into a full campaign setting.
A beautiful poster map of Freeport by cartographer Andy Law.


Freeport, where every block brings danger and every day may be your last. Come for the pirates, stay for the cosmic horror!

175401.name: Ruck und Sack: ein Aufstieg mit Haken
175401.description:
In this game the players climb a mountain.
The mountain is a 3D pyramid, build out of 4 triangles.
This mountain has many holes, which are connected to a net of paths. Each hole is marked with a colored ring around.
On players turn he rolls a dice, and decides which path he wants to go with exact this number of holes.
If there is already a hook placed, he can hang his backpack (marks the players positon) on this.
Is there is no hook he has to make an action or answer a question (dependent on the hole color). If he was successful he can place a new hook and place his backpack on it.
For some cards and wrong answered questions the player gets garbage.
To win the game, the player must had climbing on all four sides of the mountain (called 4 seasons of the year) and reach the Peak cross first. This is only allowed if the player has no garbage. The garbage can be reduced with some of the actions done or some Kind of questions answered. Sometimes just with getting the right card on the action Points you reduce garbage.

For more than 4 players there is a team rule included.

175402.name: Mythos Epic Gamemastering (EGS)
175402.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Olympians have spoken and you are to join the ranks of heroes and heroines involved in the Heavenly Contest! The Olympian deities are in a race to find the successor to Zeus’s throne, with the successor acquiring the greatest number of followers. But the gods and goddesses are quite busy, and to shine their light upon the mortals of Hellas requires intervention of a divine scale. Heroic deeds are a must if one is to prove themselves worthy for the gratification of Olympus and the pursuit of seeing their patron deity rise to rulership! Are you strong, brave, and smart enough for the challenge? We will see how you fair against the great beasts of Hellas and the heroes and heroines who support your rival deity. This is the Heavenly Contest. This is Mythos!

In Mythos, you assume the role of a demigod or devoted human of the gods and goddesses of Olympus in a heroic mythological representation of Ancient Greece. Heroes and heroines join in the Heavenly Contest to prove their worth to the deities and spread the word of their patron deity to the mortals of Hellas, in hopes of raising their patron deity to the Olympus throne. Heroes and heroines come from all walks of life, representing their patron deity as adventurers, fighters, hoplites, Olympic athletes, courtesans, sages, and rogues. Through affiliations with deific cults and Mystery Cults, they gain access to great powers and follow the strands of Fate as they travel Hellas in search of their next, grand performance.

Inside Epic Gamemastering you will find:

An introduction to Hellas and it's major locations
GM's guide to creating epic campaigns
Random adventure creator
A collection of epic tales
A large collection of epic fiends to throw at your heroes
An introductory adventure
… and more!

175403.name: White Box Omnibus: Player & Referee Options
175403.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Omnibus of Old School Adventure and Options!

Now you can get it all in one place! White Box Omnibus is a compilation of all the material found in White Box Companion, White Box Treasures, White Box Bestiary, White Box Adventures: The Wererat's Well, White Box Adventures: The Wizard's Tower, and White Box Adventures: The Dragon's Hoard.

But wait, there's more!

It includes twenty-five pages of new material never before published! Add a two-fisted monk to your adventuring party, experience the power of artifacts from ages past and encounter a plethora of new monsters!

Bring your Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox campaign together with the Willow Valley Gazetteer! Over twenty pages of brand new material detailing the region where all these adventures are set. Easy to drop into any campaign, it'll add depth to the featured adventures and provide hooks for even more sword & sorcery thrills! Brave the Swamps of Sithiss or explore the Stoneaxe Citadel! Visit the halflings of Burrowmoor and help the citizens of Willowford find peace!

Over 120 pages of Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox fun!

175404.name: Warrior Horde of the Einherjar
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
175404.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lo, do I see my Father!

Warrior Horde of the Einherjar is a new Patron for use with the Dungeon Crawl Classics roleplaying game. Is your wizard willing to trade blood for power? What sacrifices will you make to gain the favor of the Warrior horde and the almighty All-Father?

Included in Warrior Horde of the Einherjar is a complete patron and four new monsters! That includes rules for Invoke Patron, Spellburn, and unique spells - all in the name of battle!

rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
175405.name: Monk
175405.description:
From publisher blurb:

Live and Die with Honor

The Monk is a complete class for the Dungeon Crawl Classics roleplaying game. Channeling the power of Zen and honing both body and mind to perfection, you need to weapon to fell even the mightest foe. Whether a stealthy shinobi, an honorable samurai or a disciplined sensei, you need no swords, no gods, no patron to claim both gold and glory.

175406.name: Kaiju Codex
175406.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s Going to be Colossal!

Kaiju Codex brings you 20 new massive monsters for Game Masters to use in their Pathfinder Roleplaying Game ranging from the natural disaster style CR 30 Worldshaker to the lesser Kaiju like CR 8 Hubrun, The Big Goblin, so you can find a challenge to fit your game! This product builds on the existing Kaiju rules of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game while adding some new twist so you can make the existing Kaiju even more dangerous!

We also include The Iron Knight for Player Characters to crew, so you can have Kaiju vs Mech-like combat. There is an artifact for PCs to control a Kaiju for a short period of time, so you can Let Them Fight! Plus advice on GMing Kaiju so your game can play like a Japanese Monster Movie or focus on something more classical like Jörmungandr, The World Serpent.

175407.name: And the Goblin Boss Wailed
175407.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Blade orcs have displaced the Horned Skull goblins. The goblin tribe is now on the move bringing disease and violence with them. The line between refugees and raiders can be faint indeed. Regardless, the goblins are a problem that must be dealt with immediately, but circumstances have the established communities too weak to address the Horned Skulls through conventional means. Heroes must be found to perform the tasks that must be done. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 second level characters. This is the second episode in the Red Blade War series.

175408.name: And the Dwarf Thane Slept
175408.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the fever epidemic raging, resources are stretched thin amid rumors of war from the south. The communities of the Alshon region have learned to rely on a group of hardy adventurers as leaders and heroes. Someone must make the dangerous journey to the isolated dwarves of the northeast in order to recover vital spell components; otherwise the stability of the entire region is compromised. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 2nd and 3rd level Characters. This is the third episode in the Red Blade War series.

175409.name: The Poison Works
175409.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the epidemic subsides, and with some allies in place, it is time for a foray into Red Blades territory. And intelligence has provided a target that could undermine the orcs' effectiveness if taken out. So the job falls on the shoulders of adventurers. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 3rd level Characters. This is the fourth episode in the Red Blade War series.

175410.name: Red Blades Diplomacy
175410.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Blade orcs have expanded to the point that they must engage the human communities of the Alshon region. The recent raid on Fashat Xom is bound to elicit a response from the orc khan, but what form will it take. The human leadership prepares feverishly as it waits nervously for the Red Blades next move. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 third level characters. This is the fifth episode in the Red Blade War series.

175411.name: The Siege of Mardleton
175411.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Blades orcs’ Great Khan Zugbu sent an ambassador with a promise of peace. But it was not a promise for perpetual peace, and the Red Blades now seek to take by force what was denied them through diplomacy. The communities of Mardleton and Neilsfort have always been the bastions against the threats from the Farwood, but unless heroic action is taken immediately, these villages will become the latest conquests of the Red Blades A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 third level characters. This is the sixth episode in the Red Blade War series.

175412.name: Red Blades Infiltration
175412.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wars are not always won or lost on the front line. Even an overwhelming army must be fed and resupplied, and sometimes the most important action is behind the frontline by commandos and spies. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 third level characters. This is the seventh episode in the Red Blade War series.

175413.name: The Head of the Snake
175413.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Red Blades orcs have proven to be a formidable force. Even with outside help it is questionable whether the humans and their allies can complete a campaign in the Farwood against a determined, capable enemy native to the jungle. However, a smaller force may be able to penetrate to the interior and end the war with a precision attack. A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 third - fourth level characters. This is the eighth (and climactic) episode in the Red Blade War series.

175414.name: Spider Butte
175414.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ahhhh… That sweet spider venom. Well, you didn’t think it would be “easy” did you? To secure a giant spider, there is an obvious place to go: Spider Butte. But there are reasons no one else has ventured to this forbidding mesa A Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 third level characters.

175415.name: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 1 – Somalia Intervention
boardgameexpansion: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent
175415.description:
Modern Africa is not a great period for any of the so-called superpowers. No one has been able to pacify or even influence for any length of time events in Africa. As stated in the rules, Modern Africa, generic is the key with a tribal mindset against the big green (or red) machine. When time has passed, only the Africans are left in Africa. So, with this in mind, let´s move on this set of seven scenarios based on the book "Blackhawk down".

And good luck on those morale rolls!

Scenarios include:
Raid, The Gauntlet, Cornered, Defense of Crash Site Super 6, Blackhawk Down Campaign Game, Embassy Evacuation, and Overland Embassy Relief.

Special Rules cover:
Body Armor, Night Vision, Off-Board Artillery, Airstrikes, Hostages, and Helicopters.

175416.name: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 2 – Marine! Intervention Operations in the Third World
boardgameexpansion: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent
175416.description:
Modern Africa continues to be the world´s weak sister. Unable to govern themselves and ungovernable from without, Africa stands as an enigma. The scenario book that James Meldrum has put together is a superb collection of "what if", thought provoking gaming possibilities.

And good luck on those morale rolls!

Scenarios include:
Beach Head Assault 1 and 2, Embassy Raid, Ship Rescue, Recovery of a Warship, POW Rescue, Installation Raid 1 and 2, Urban Hostage Rescue, Embassy Relief and Arctic Confrontation.

Special Rules cover:
Elite Troops, Body Armor, Night Vision, Off-Board Artillery, Airstrikes, Hostages, Helicopters, Hostile Casualties, Terrain, Snipers and Amphibious Landings.

175417.name: Modern Africa: Scenario Book 3 – Tears: SEAL Operations in Nigeria
boardgameexpansion: Modern Africa: Rules for modern skirmish battles on the dark continent
175417.description:
Modern Africa continues to be the world´s weak sister. Unable to govern themselves and ungovernable from without, Africa stands as an enigma. The scenario book that James Meldrum has put together is yet another superb collection of thought provoking gaming possibilities.

And good luck on those morale rolls!

Scenarios include:
Doctor Evacuation, Encounter with Militia, Ethnic Cleansing, Initial Skirmish, Main Battle, Retreat to the Border, Battle Campaign, and Campaign.

Special Rules cover:
SEAL Team Detachment, Body Armor, Night Vision, Off-Board Artillery, US Navy Airstrikes, Hostages, Nigerian Army Casualties, Hidden Movement, and Silenced Weapons.

175418.description:
What does your Aura reveal?

• Aura is an easy to learn, but difficult to master, strategy card game for 2-4 players.
• Enjoyed by casual and hardcore gamers alike, Aura is the perfect gateway into the world of modern card games.
• Outwit and bluff your way to victory, but remain flexible, because when the cards are revealed anything can happen.

Begin the game with your own deck of cards. Five distinct types of cards are represented by the five colors in your deck. The colors are visible on both the backs and fronts of each card to give the effect of an observable aura when in your hand. Take turns playing cards face down in an attempt to both protect your deck and to remove cards from your opponents’ deck. Win by having the most cards remaining at the end of the game.
175418.name: Aura

175419.name: Yin-yang dice
boardgamepublisher: ペンとサイコロ (Pen and Dice)
175419.description:
Publisher's summary:
陰陽賽　－おんみょうさい－ (Yin-yang dice) is published in Japanese and English and combines dice play and strategy. Players roll or place dice to score more points than the others. Players can get more points with "Holy beast" coloured dice, and they can hide their colour to score even higher. Although this is a dice game, and players need a little luck, there is a lot of strategy involved.

Publisher's summary:
プレイヤーは陰陽師となり、ダイスを配置してその点数を競います。
ダイスを配置する・転がすのに加え、一度だけ使用できる「霊獣」でコンボを組めばより大きな点数が狙えます。
ダイスを使っても運の要素の少ない、心理と戦略のゲームです。

175420.name: 7 little korpokkurs
boardgamepublisher: ペンとサイコロ (Pen and Dice)
175420.description:
Publisher's summary:
コロポックル　見～つけた! (7 little korpokkurs) is a children's game published in Japanese and English.

A Korpokkur is a small fairy in the Hokkaido district in Japan. In this game, you play hide and seek with Korpokkurs. You trade chips and gather not leaves but Korpokkurs. Simple rules and easy to play with small children, but adults can play it as a harder mind game.

Publisher's summary:
アイヌのコロポックルたちが隠れんぼしています。
プレイヤーはフキの葉に隠れるコロポックル達を捕まえましょう。
ルールは簡単。でも心理戦の熱い、チップ交換ゲームです。

175421.name: Tiptoi bordspel: Het mysterie van het getalleneiland
175421.description:
Solve the math problems and collect the treasure chests on this mysterious island with TIPTOI interactive learningsystem.

The treasure chests on this island are guarded by a parrot, a mermaid, a dolphin and a pirate. They teach simple math problems to the players during their turn. If the player solves the problem he can keep the treasure chest. The player who collects the most treasures wins the game.

The game contains four difficulty levels.

175422.name: Yoon-Suin
175422.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yoon-Suin is a campaign toolbox for fantasy games, giving you the equipment necessary to run a sandbox campaign in your own Yoon-Suin - a region of high adventure shrouded in ancient mysteries, opium smoke, great luxury and opulent cruelty.

Contains:

A bestiary of unique monsters, including self-mummified monks, liquid golems, tiger-beetle men, figments, and dozens more
A new character class, the Crab-man
A chapter for each of the major regions of Yoon-Suin, filled with random generators to brainstorm map contents, social groups, and more
Extended rules for poisons, tea, opium, trade, deities and so on
Extended rules for exploring the Old Town of the Yellow City, and the haunted jungles of Lahag
Many encounter tables
Well over 100 pre-written adventure locales to populate a regional map
Over 300 pages of content
Purple prose

175423.name: The Board: Fantasy skirmish wargame
175423.description:
The Board: Fantasy skirmish wargame.
Chapter One: The Frondglaucous Conflict.

In a world of God and mortals, several races fighting for control of The Triple Gift. Make a band of humans, dwarves, ugris, samaris, egir, sorgoins (snake-humans), alares, mercenaries...

In this chaptes you can use both dwarves and ugris.

175424.name: Description Cards: Storyteller's Deck
175424.description:
Publisher's Description:

This 80-card deck is filled with inspiring ways to describe the delicate nuances of your world. Each card contains action words to spark the imagination, followed by multiple examples of their use.

Broken up into 6 individual sets, each set is separately illustrated by Rafael Dorsz and printed on large 4.25” x 2.75” (Tarot-sized) cards.

The 80 Cards are broken down into 6 sets, they are:

Ill Intent Cards (12 Cards)
Expressions Cards (12 Cards)
Character Distinctions Cards (12 Cards)
Environment Cards (12 Cards)
Pain Cards (12 Cards)
Labyrinth Cards (12 Cards)
6 Blank Cards (1 of each type)
1 Instruction Card and 1 Ad Card

175425.name: Description Cards: Writer's & GM Screen
175425.description:
Publisher's Description:

This beautiful 4-panel screen features magnificent art by Rafael Dorsz on the outer panels. On the inside you will find hundreds of inspirational examples of ways you can describe characters in intense fantasy combat. Strategically organized by the type of damage the character wishes to inflict and the fighting style the character is performing. The types of damage include: BLUNT - Damage caused by non-penetrating force; SLASHING - Damage caused by a sharp edge; and PIERCING - Damage caused by a sharp point. The combat styles include: FINESSE - A character who fights with style and grace, such as the Swashbuckler or Martial Artist; POWER - A character whose fight is based on strength and vigor, such as the Barbarian or Thug; and RANGE - A character who is using a thrown or distance weapon such as a javelin or bow.

Plus Additional descriptions from the Description Cards Storytelling Deck:

Ill Intent Cards (A handful of descriptions)
Expressions Cards (A handful of descriptions)
Character Distinctions Cards (A handful of descriptions)
Environment Cards (A handful of descriptions)
Pain Cards (A handful of descriptions)
Labyrinth Cards (A handful of descriptions)

175427.name: Bible Hunter
175427.description:
Bible Hunter is a card game with themes from the Old and New testament, with artwork in manga style. The game has three types of cards, characters (red cards), that can be persons like the patriarchs or prophets, Jesus or the apostles, and items, like swords or money (green), and mission cards (blue).

Players starts with four cards, two characters and two missions. The players take turns, selects one of the three cards on the board, and then tries to collect this by playing one character card. The strongest character gets the card. It is good to have strong characters, but some of the gives minus points if in hand then a round is completed, eg. Satan (-20 victory points)

The cards collected can be put together to complete a story. The round ends then a player can complete a whole biblical story, and then all players count there victory points. The game is played in three rounds, and the player with most victory points after the third round is the winner.

175428.name: Et la Nuit Résonnera de 1000 Crimes
rpgissuearticle: On y a joué: Wastburg: Et la nuit résonnera de mille crimes
175428.description:
(translated) Publisher Blurb:

"To produce quality beer (at least from the sanitary point of view ; taste being a real luxury), you need water (the purest possible ; in Wastburg, the least dirty), barley (hops is for aristocracy), some hardware and a good distribution network. [...] Once brewed, it must be delivered and drunk promptly or get spoiled. This assume you have casks, cask deposit and refund system, carts, delivery persons to delivery full casks and recover empty ones while the brewers work on the next batch. [...] Unless you heavily invest in a brand new brewery and aim for the high end, it is a risky enterprise, and a market hard to conquer. Even more when an old house alread holds it all."

This adventure module for semi-experienced guards (PCs) offer several entangled plot lines that will keep them busy for a compete night. And not one spend slacking in a tavern wait for time to pass, but running all night, making decisions on the spot without thinking and suffer the consequences of their acts.

Include rules to manage expenses.

175430.name: Capital Edition
175430.description:
From the rules:
"Capital Edition is designed to help you enjoy Washington, D.C. before and after you visit."

Capital Edition is a roll-and-move trivia game designed to teach players about Washington, D.C. Players start at the beginning of a track printed around the outer edge of the board. On each turn, they roll the die and move along the track, landing on one of many types of spaces. On a monument space, the player gains the trophy card for that monument. A Metro space allows a player to move to any other Metro space. A Tourmobile space allows movement to any monument, but the player must answer a question from a Challenge card to win a trophy card. On a challenge space, the player draws a challenge card and asks another player the question. On an incorrect answer, that player must return a trophy card to the board. On a take a card space, the player must choose a card and answer the question to continue. There are also roll again and lose a turn spaces.

Players' turns end in one of four ways--answering a question incorrectly, answering three consecutive questions correctly, winning a trophy card or landing on a "lose a turn" square.

Players continue to circle the board until one player collects trophy cards for all four monuments, winning the game.

175431.name: Trojan Challenge
175431.description:
